intro: Scorzonera candollei, commonly known as the Candolle's scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. Its leaves are alternate, broadly ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Scorzonera candollei thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to rocky or alpine soils.
